Word.name: authority
Word.Definition: the power or right to give orders or make decisions
(usually plural) persons who exercise (administrative) control over others
an administrative unit of government
an expert whose views are taken as definitive
an authoritative written work
freedom from doubt; belief in yourself and your abilities
official permission or approval

Word.name: consumption
Word.Definition: the act of consuming something
the process of taking food into the body through the mouth (as by eating)
(economics) the utilization of economic goods to satisfy needs or in manufacturing
a disease involving the lungs with progressive wasting of the body

Word.name: omen
Word.Definition: a sign of something about to happen
indicate by signs

Word.name: prohibition
Word.Definition: the action of prohibiting or inhibiting or forbidding (or an instance thereof)
refusal to approve or assent to
a decree that prohibits something
a law forbidding the sale of alcoholic beverages
the period from 1920 to 1933 when the sale of alcoholic beverages was prohibited in the United States by a constitutional amendment

Word.name: superstition
Word.Definition: an irrational belief arising from ignorance or fear

Word.name: taboo
Word.Definition: an inhibition or ban resulting from social custom or emotional aversion
a prejudice (especially in Polynesia and other South Pacific islands) that prohibits the use or mention of something because of its sacred nature
excluded from use or mention
forbidden to profane use especially in South Pacific islands
declare as sacred and forbidden

Word.name: abhor
Word.Definition: find repugnant

Word.name: attribute
Word.Definition: an abstraction belonging to or characteristic of an entity
a construct whereby objects or individuals can be distinguished
decide as to where something belongs in a scheme
attribute or credit to

Word.name: violate
Word.Definition: fail to agree with; be in violation of; as of rules or patterns
act in disregard of laws, rules, contracts, or promises
destroy
destroy and strip of its possession
force (someone) to have sex against their will
violate the sacred character of a place or language

Word.name: arbitrary
Word.Definition: based on or subject to individual discretion or preference or sometimes impulse or caprice

Word.name: linguistic
Word.Definition: consisting of or related to language
of or relating to the scientific study of language

Word.name: offensive
Word.Definition: the action of attacking an enemy
unpleasant or disgusting especially to the senses
causing or able to cause nausea
causing anger or annoyance
substitute a harsher or distasteful term for a mild one
violating or tending to violate or offend against
morally offensive
for the purpose of attack rather than defense

Word.name: rational
Word.Definition: an integer or a fraction
consistent with or based on or using reason
of or associated with or requiring the use of the mind
having its source in or being guided by the intellect (as distinguished from experience or emotion)
capable of being expressed as a quotient of integers

Word.name: supernatural
Word.Definition: supernatural forces and events and beings collectively
not existing in nature or subject to explanation according to natural laws; not physical or material

Word.name: advertisement
Word.Definition: a public promotion of some product or service

Word.name: campaign
Word.Definition: several related operations aimed at achieving a particular goal (usually within geographical and temporal constraints)
a series of actions advancing a principle or tending toward a particular end
a race between candidates for elective office
an overland journey by hunters (especially in Africa)
exert oneself continuously, vigorously, or obtrusively to gain an end or engage in a crusade for a certain cause or person; be an advocate for
go on a campaign; go off to war
run, stand, or compete for an office or a position

Word.name: circular
Word.Definition: an advertisement (usually printed on a page or in a leaflet) intended for wide distribution
having a circular shape
describing a circle; moving in a circle

Word.name: commercial
Word.Definition: a commercially sponsored ad on radio or television
connected with or engaged in or sponsored by or used in commerce or commercial enterprises
of the kind or quality used in commerce; average or inferior
of or relating to commercialism

Word.name: jingle
Word.Definition: a metallic sound
a comic verse of irregular measure
make a sound typical of metallic objects

Word.name: slogan
Word.Definition: a favorite saying of a sect or political group

Word.name: product
Word.Definition: an artifact that has been created by someone or some process
commodities offered for sale
a consequence of someone's efforts or of a particular set of circumstances
a chemical substance formed as a result of a chemical reaction
a quantity obtained by multiplication
the set of elements common to two or more sets

Word.name: telemarketing
Word.Definition: the use of the telephone as an interactive medium for promotion and sales

Word.name: advertise
Word.Definition: make publicity for; try to sell (a product)
call attention to

Word.name: convince
Word.Definition: make (someone) agree, understand, or realize the truth or validity of something

Word.name: hype
Word.Definition: blatant or sensational promotion
publicize in an exaggerated and often misleading manner

Word.name: promote
Word.Definition: give a promotion to or assign to a higher position
contribute to the progress or growth of
make publicity for; try to sell (a product)
be changed for a superior chess or checker piece
change a pawn for a better piece by advancing it to the eighth row, or change a checker piece for a more valuable piece by moving it to the row closest to your opponent

Word.name: exaggerated
Word.Definition: enlarged to an abnormal degree
represented as greater than is true or reasonable
